instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Hello Im a Newbie me and i have problem with this mac...i replace the c9560 and no crash (before i have random crash)but now every time when awake from sleep the laptop crash......after that the laptop take 30 sec to chime...my macbook is 820-2850-a i have schem for 820-2850.is the same c9560 330uf 2v or 2.5v bocose the graphic ram is 512...i dont know what can i do.....thanks i forget when connect mini dvi or run benchmark the dispay change a little tint blue but no crash.....thanks

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Does it go to sleep with the pulsing light? Does it even wake up or does it crash while asleep?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: I put it to sleep fan stop and after the led light leeping....after awake fun spin but nothing on screen.after 30 sec restart.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Do you know if this happened before replacing C9560?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Did exactly the same with random black screen

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: I found yet after crash and I go to open it takes too much light in front is very muted and after several seconds starts screen

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: But if i close it normally and go to the open open at once

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message:
It is normal to take longer to boot after a crash.

I have no idea, check if C9560 was properly soldered or replace it again. Some of these boards also just have a bad GPU and the problem is not only C9560.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: i messure the voltage on c9560 is 1.3v and full load 1.8v is ok? and then the laptop crash is 1.3v with black screen and fan spin

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Voltage switching in normal, has nothing to do with the crashing. You can connect pin 2 and 3 of Q9581 together to disable the voltage switching, I doubt it will help though.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: how can i check if the gpu is bad?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Heat up the GPU to about 120C, check with wet finger if it sizzles, check for crashing again.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: What else could I look at before I arrive at this point to warm up the card. You passes none of the mind? How is it possible not to crash with the bentchmarks?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: i have a second macbook pro 2010 17" with tint blue change on screen when plugin to mini dvi and run multi monitors but that working perfect without crash

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: The tint change is normal. I gave all the option there are. If you do not have the possibility to change the GPU this board will not get fixed.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: Hi i run the ASD with this (ERROR -- 5 [No SMART attributes to check] -- TEST FAILED )but not worry about that....in the morning i try to open the laptop (i close it normaly)but take 1:00-1:30 minute to chime.....next step heat the GPU....:(:(:(

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: i replace the c9560 with a new one,heat gpu 150c but the problem still there......i have one freeze when i change the graphic card from energy setting....wtf......maybe gpu dying......

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message:
wtf now the mac not load the intel graphics

After restart the intel graphics is there

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: The GPU is failing. End of story, period. Replace it or the board will continue to have issues.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: from where can i order a good one not fake n11p-ge1-w-a3?any idea?im from greece!!!!!

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: If you have to ask where to get a GPU then I must ask the question have you ever done this before?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message:
I'm not a pro but I deal a lot with the profession and I've managed to fix many laptops as chip backlight. I have all the tools to start the process but first I will deal with old boards is my own laptop I have it So......

irda station

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: What model rework station do you have?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message: the model is  IR 6500

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2010 i7 crash when put to sleep
threads.message:
If you have not done GPU rework before go and try it on scrap boards first. There is 0% chance on success if you try to do this the first time on your fixable board. Start with a scrap board and see if you can get reliable results without destroying the board first.
My advice with this machine is not to try and fix it, success rate on these will not be high. Better to sell in this condition as there are enough idiots that pay a lot of money for these.
